question: What is the updated compute capacity status for Narval?
answer: Narval's compute capacity will be at 100% until February 6, 2025, then again at 30% for the last Rorqual tests, as of the January 30, 2025 update.

question: When are Béluga and Narval expected to return to 100% capacity?
answer: Béluga and Narval should be back to 100% capacity on February 14, 2025.

question: Where can users find updated information regarding Béluga and Narval capacity?
answer: For updated information, users can visit https://status.alliancecan.ca.

question: What is the scheduled shutdown period for Niagara and Mist compute nodes on January 22, 2025?
answer: Niagara and Mist compute nodes will be shut down on January 22, 2025, from 8 AM to 5 PM EST.

question: What is the reason for the Niagara and Mist compute node shutdown on January 22, 2025?
answer: The shutdown is to support ongoing system improvements and the integration with the new system, Trillium.

question: Which services will remain available during the January 22, 2025 outage for Niagara and Mist?
answer: The login nodes, file systems, and the HPSS system will remain available during the January 22, 2025 outage.

question: How will the scheduler handle jobs submitted during the Niagara and Mist compute node shutdown?
answer: The scheduler will hold jobs that are submitted until the maintenance has finished.

question: What is the duration and type of event scheduled for the Cedar compute cluster starting January 13, 2025?
answer: The Cedar compute cluster will experience a 9-day outage, from January 13, 2025, to January 21, 2025, for infrastructure renewal.

question: What will happen to jobs submitted to the Cedar cluster during its shutdown from January 13-21, 2025?
answer: Jobs submitted to the cluster will queue. Those that can complete before the shutdown may start running, while jobs that cannot will remain in the queue until the cluster is fully operational on January 21.

question: What action is required for important data on the Cedar /scratch filesystem before the January 13, 2025 outage?
answer: Users must immediately move any important data from the Cedar /scratch filesystem to their /project, /nearline, or /home directory because it will be migrated to new storage.

question: Will Cedar cloud services be affected during the Cedar compute cluster shutdown from January 13-21, 2025?
answer: No, Cedar cloud will remain operational during this period.

question: When is Niagara scheduled for a full power shutdown?
answer: Niagara is scheduled for a full power shutdown from November 25, 2024, to November 26, 2024.

question: What is the reason for the Niagara full power shutdown on November 25-26, 2024?
answer: The shutdown is for main panel upgrades ahead of the Trillium cluster setup.

question: What services will be affected during the Niagara power shutdown on November 25-26, 2024?
answer: All Niagara services, including the cluster and scheduler, will pause during this time.

question: What job submission advice is given to users before the Niagara power shutdown on November 25, 2024?
answer: Users are encouraged to submit smaller, short-duration jobs to optimize idle node usage before the maintenance begins.

question: When will all systems and storage at the SciNet Datacenter be unavailable?
answer: All systems and storage at the SciNet Datacenter will be unavailable from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET on November 7-8, 2024.

question: Which specific systems at the SciNet Datacenter will be affected by the November 7-8, 2024 outage?
answer: Niagara, Mist, HPSS, Rouge, Teach, JupyterHub, and Balam will be unavailable during this outage.

question: Why is the SciNet Datacenter outage necessary on November 7-8, 2024?
answer: This outage is necessary for installing new electrical equipment (UPS) as part of a systems refresh.

question: What recommendation is given to users regarding job scheduling before the SciNet Datacenter outage?
answer: Users can prioritize short jobs to utilize otherwise idle nodes prior to maintenance.

question: When will Cedar compute nodes be unavailable in November 2024?
answer: Cedar compute nodes will be unavailable from 6 a.m. PST on November 7, 2024, to 6 a.m. PST on November 8, 2024.

question: What Cedar services will remain operational during the November 7-8, 2024 outage?
answer: Cedar login nodes, storage, and cloud services will remain operational and unaffected during this period.
